html.p: Enable selection of multiple values in a form input, and apply that to your search query. This input provides the flexibility to configure the prefix adn suffix values, as well as the delimiter to apply between values.
To support this multi-value selection, there are a few additional parameters included for this input type:

ul.li: valuePrefix- This value gets prefixed to each selected value (repeated for n values)
valueSuffix- This value gets appended to each selected value (repeated for n values)
delimiter- This value gets inserted between each selection (only applied if value greater than 1)

div.p: Let's say that you want to allow users to select sourcetypes, and you want the end search query to look like:
To produce this output, you will need to set the following:
div.pre: <input type="multiselect" token="s_sourcetype" searchWhenChanged="true"> <label>Sourcetype</label> <choice value="*">ANY</choice> <populatingSearch fieldForLabel="Category" fieldForValue="Category">index=_internal | stats count by sourcetype | sort asc sourcetype</populatingSearch> <default>*</default> <prefix>(</prefix> <suffix>)</suffix> <valuePrefix>sourcetype="</valuePrefix> <valueSuffix>"</valueSuffix> <delimiter> OR </delimiter> </input> ... <searchString>index=_internal $s_sourcetype$ | top source</searchString>

div.p: Let's say that you want to allow users to select enumerated values from a db, and you want the end search query to look like:
div.code: dbquery my_db "select * from my_table where sourcetype in (foo, bar);"
div.p: To produce this output, you will need to set the following:
div.pre: <input type="multiselect" token="s_values" searchWhenChanged="true"> <label>Values</label> <choice value="foo">foo</choice> <choice value="bar">bar</choice> <choice value="baz">baz</choice> <delimiter>, </delimiter> </input> ... <searchString>dbquery my_db "select * from my_table where sourcetype in ($s_values$);"</searchString>
